description: From Middle English penywort; equivalent to penny +â€Ž wort.

definitionGroups.group: Any of several not closely related plants around the world, generally with round leaves of about the shape and size of a penny.

entries.meaning: (in Europe) A succulent, perennial flowering plant (Umbilicus rupestris; penny-pies, wall pennywort, kidney wort, navelwort) in the stonecrop family (Crassulaceae).
(in Asia) The edible Asiatic pennywort (Centella asiatica)
examples: Synonyms: Asiatic pennywort, gotu kola, Indian pennywort, spade leaf

entries.meaning: Aquatic or semi-aquatic plants in the genus Hydrocotyle (water pennywort, Indian pennywort, marsh penny, thick-leaved pennywort, and white rot).
such as the edible dollarweed (Hydrocotyle umbellata)
Cymbalaria aequitriloba, a plant with tiny ivy-like leaves with copious purple-pink flowers with yellow throats.
